verses.text: Hear the right, O \sc Lord\sc*, attend unto my cry, Give ear unto my prayer, \add that goeth\add* not out of feigned lips.
Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; Let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.
Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited \add me\add* in the night; Thou hast tried me, \add and\add* shalt find nothing; I am purposed \add that\add* my mouth shall not transgress.
Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept \add me from\add* the paths of the destroyer.
Hold up my goings in thy paths, \add That\add* my footsteps slip not.
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: Incline thine ear unto me, \add and\add* hear my speech.
Shew thy marvellous loving-kindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust \add in thee\add* From those that rise up \add against them\add*.
Keep me as the apple of the eye, Hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
From the wicked that oppress me, \add From\add* my deadly enemies, \add who\add* compass me about.
They are inclosed \add in\add* their own fat: \add With\add* their mouth they speak proudly.
They have now compassed us \add in\add* our steps: They have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;
Like as a lion \add that\add* is greedy of his prey, And as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
Arise, O \sc Lord\sc*, disappoint him, cast him down: Deliver my soul from the wicked, \add which is\add* thy sword:

From men \add which are\add* thy hand, O \sc Lord\sc*, From men of the world, \add which have\add* their portion in \add this\add* life, And whose belly thou fillest \add with\add* thy hid \add treasure:\add* They are full \add of\add* children, And leave the rest of their \add substance\add* to their babes.
\add As for\add* me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when \add I\add* awake, \add with\add* thy likeness.
